definition: agnosticism, the philosophical doctrine that some questions about the universe are in principle unanswerable
(negative prefix)/not/no
see 可汗[ke4 han2]
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
to know/to be aware
abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)

sentences.english: Catholics are agnostic to the Protestant creeds.
sentences.chinese: 天主教徒对于新教教义来说，是不可知论者。

sentences.english: He said the agnostics were also demanding a "more even-handed" bibliography.
sentences.chinese: 他说不可知论者也要求一个“更加公平的”书目。

sentences.english: I think sometimes that agnosticism can lead to a moral maturity.
sentences.chinese: 我想，有时候这种不可知论能够通向道德成熟。

sentences.english: So atheism and agnosticism became the fashion of the day.
sentences.chinese: 无神论和不可知论成为了当时的时尚。

sentences.english: Balian and his father appear to be agnostics.
sentences.chinese: 巴利安和他父亲看起来像不可知论者。

sentences.english: The past few years I've really become an agnostic.
sentences.chinese: 过去几年来，我真可说成了一个不可知论者。

sentences.english: Ron Artest is dyslexic, agnostic, and an insomniac.
sentences.chinese: 阿泰是一个朗诵困难者，不可知论者和失眠患者。

sentences.english: He's an atheist, she pretty much agnostic.
sentences.chinese: 他是一名无神论者，她则基本上是不可知论者。

sentences.english: I think sometimes that agnosticism can lead to a moral maturity.
sentences.chinese: 我想有时这种不可知论能够通向道德成熟。

sentences.english: In terms of Westerners, agnostics is "no religious belief."
sentences.chinese: 在西方人来讲，不可知论者只是“没有宗教信仰”。

sentences.english: I have mentioned that Locke was very agnostic.
sentences.chinese: 我提到过，洛克是个不可知论者。

sentences.english: Q. How many agnostics does it take to screw in a light bulb?
sentences.chinese: 把一个灯泡转进灯座，需要多少位不可知论者呢？

sentences.english: In Europe, the rise of atheism and agnosticism is stunning.
sentences.chinese: 在欧洲无神论和不可知论的兴起令人感到震惊。
爱因斯坦是个不可知论者。

sentences.english: Atheism and agnosticism are increasing in number.
sentences.chinese: 无神论者和不可知论者的数量越来越多。

definition: metaphysics
philosophy of idealism, the doctrine that external reality is a product of consciousness
philosophy of idealism, the doctrine that external reality is a product of consciousness
gnosticism, the philosophical doctrine that everything about the universe is knowable
theism (the belief in the existence of God)
deism, theological theory of God who does not interfere in the Universe
nihilism
(philosophy) rationalism
epistemology (in philosophy, the theory of how we know things)
dualism, belief that the universe is made of two different substance (e.g. mind and matter or good and evil)
pantheism, theological theory equating God with the Universe
scientism
materialistic
the philosophy of materialism, doctrine that physical matter is the whole of reality
ontology
materialism, philosophical doctrine that physical matter is the whole of reality
